description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Win32k elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-30028), you are advised to apply the specific security updates relevant to your Windows version:

1. Download and install the appropriate updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog for your system:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 (KB5037771): [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 (KB5037771): [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771)
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 (KB5037770): [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037770)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64 (KB5037768): [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64 (KB5037788): [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037788)

2. Restart your system after applying these updates to ensure they take effect.

**Details**:
- This patch addresses a critical flaw identified as CWE-416 (Use After Free), allowing for elevation of privilege.
- Ensure your system is fully backed up prior to applying updates.
- The maximum severity of this vulnerability is classified as important.

**Preconditions**:
- Only apply the updates that correspond to your system’s build number.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
